thread.section_title: Kanye West News plus Breakdown, Twitter and Album Updates | Daily Mail Online
thread.title: Alex Trebek raps Drake and West songs on Jeopardy!
thread.title_full: Alex Trebek raps Drake and Kanye West songs on Jeopardy! | Daily Mail Online

author: Cheyenne Roundtree For Dailymail.com
title: Alex Trebek raps Drake and West songs on Jeopardy!
text:
Chart-topping tunes from Kanye West , Desiigner and Drake received a surprising remix from Alex Trebek on an episode of Jeopardy!.
Trebek, the longstanding host of the game show, delighted audiences as he rapped hit songs from some of the rap industry's biggest names on Monday's episode.
The 76-year-old TV icon showed off his skills to college students as he dropped lines from Kanye West's Famous and Drake's Started From the Bottom, and remarked: 'I'm not too good at it but I was getting into it.'
Alex Trebek, the host of Jeopardy!, took on rapping hit songs from Drake and Kanye West on Monday's episode of the game show
The game show host delighted the audience when he rapped Drake's (left) Started From the Bottom and Kanye West's (right) controversial Famous
He added before heading to a commercial break: 'I was just getting into this rap thing.'
The episode was the College Championship Semi-Final and the rapping came into play during the Let's Rap, Kids category.
Trebek has been the man at the helm of the quiz show since 1984 and social media loved his hip-hop performance that included lyrics from Kendrick Lamar and Desiigner.
The Panda hit-maker seemed to enjoy watching Trebek rattle off his lyrics and retweeted a clip of the host with fire and panda emojis.
Rapper Desiigner seemed to approve of Trebek's performance of his song Panda and retweeted a clip with fire and panda emojis
Both Drake and Kanye West were included in the category Let's Rap, Kids
The New York musician wasn't the only person on Twitter to appreciate Trebek's rapping skills. The social media platform was filled with users praising the segment.
One user commented the host had 'bars' and another wanted to make the clip her ringtone.
Trebek has rapped on air before, with Drake and Future's smash hit Jumpman last October.
He also has performed songs from Taylor Swift, the Beastie Boys and MC Hammer.
Social media loved the host's rapping and the clip has been shared thousands of times on Twitter
Another user joked that the night's segment was Trebek's mixtape
One Twitter user asked how she could make Trebek rapping her ringtone
Some even called for the host to make an entire cover album of the biggest rap songs
